item.title: Report E-2024090432
item.description:
Report E-2024090432

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: SAINT ROBERTS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 10, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of printer ink was punctured in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior, under cage, and roadway beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the site. EWI Scraped the inside of the trailer using hand tools and degreaser. crews placed absorbents on the trailer floor to soak up all degreaser. The gravel underneath the trailer was shoveled using hand tools until no product was left on the ground. With approval from R+L the driver was sent to the St. Louis, MO, Terminals wash bay to remediate the exterior of the trailer. All spent absorbents, as well as any damaged drums were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum which was taken back to the Springfield, MO, R+L terminal where it was staged for future disposal

item.title: Report E-2024090419
item.description:
Report E-2024090419

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 03:19 EST on 8/29, XPO-XSL contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 2 ounces of UN2078 "Solithane S 113" from a 1gal metal pail impacting the trailer floor. The pail was damaged during loading by XKC. ERTS confirmed the material to be hazard class 6.1. ERTS dispatched contractors for cleanup, however XPO terminal personnel decided to complete cleanup in house. Contractor response was canceled. XPO terminal personnel donned PPE and containerized the damaged pail and 3 other pails of the material into a 10-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2024080047
item.description:
Report I-2024080047

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-09
  • City: JOPLIN
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HARCROS CHEMICALS INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 151632
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: An unexpected medical condition caused our driver to loose consciousness while operating the vehicle which ended in a rollover. Additional hazardous materials spilled: UN3253, Disodium Trioxosilicate, 8, PG111, paper bag specs 5M2/Z26/S/23/USA/M6775, 10-50lb bags spilled totaling 500 lbs. UN3378, Sodium Carbonate Peroxyhydrate, 5.1, PGII, paper bag specs 5M2/Y27.0/S?23/USA+BR11981, 5-55Ib bags spilled totaling 27 lbs.
